thread.title: Weather forecast: Australia set for coldest snap in five years | The
thread.title_full: Weather forecast: Australia set for coldest snap in five years | The Advertiser

author: Michael Morrow
title: Weather forecast: Australia set for coldest snap in five years | The
text:
THE most powerful cold front to cross Australia’s southeast in a years will hit this weekend with forecasters warning of freezing conditions.
The weather event will start on Saturday and unusually cold conditions are expected to last until the middle of next week.
B ... Sydney is forecast an average maximum of 15 degrees over four days, which would make it the city’s coldest spell in two years.Picture: Bradley Hunter Source: News Corp Australia
Weatherzone says South Australia, Tasmania, Victoria, New South Wales, the ACT, Queensland and the Northern Territory will experience the coldest spell in at least two years, and more than five years in some places.
Adelaide’s maximum temperature is predicted to reach just 12C on Saturday, along with showers and a chance of a thunderstorm.
And there’s no reprieve in sight. The Bureau of Meteorology predicts a high of 13C on Sunday, 14C on Monday, 13C on Tuesday and back to 12C again on Wednesday.
Showers are expected for most of the next week.
Across the state, maximum temperatures in Clare are tipped to rise to just 9C on Saturday and Wednesday, while Mount Gambier will see showers and highs betwen 10C and 12C.
But in areas further east, snow is forecast to fall, including in some Melbourne suburbs and in the Blue Mountains, west of Sydney.
Mt Dandenong ... Snow is forecast to fall in some Melbourne suburbs on Sunday and Monday. Source: Supplied
“Snow should fall almost right along the Victorian and NSW ranges, falling as low as 600 metres, most likely in southernmost parts,” Weatherzone said
“This will be great news for the snow resorts which are in for a 20-to-50 centimetre powdery layer.”
The nation’s capital can expect an average maximum of about 8C over four days, the coldest since June 2009.
Snow day ... Canberra could be covered in snow as the cold front sweeps in from the south. Picture: Gary Ramage Source: News Corp Australia
Rainfall wise, the heaviest falls will be in eastern Victoria and southeastern New South Wales where up to 50mm is possible.
“These showers will at times and in some places contain small hail and combining with the bitterly cold and strong winds will add to an already exceptional chill, making the actual temperature feel as much as five degrees colder,” Weatherzone said.
The situation is being closely monitored and warnings will be issued in each state, as required, as conditions deteriorate. Icicles appear in kitchen sink in Albury, NSW 0:48 Play video
Kate Norton-Smith of Albury turned on her kitchen tap one cold morning - only to discover the water freezes solid before it even hits the sink. Courtesy: YouTube/Kate Norton-Smith via Storyful
News Corp Australia 26 Jun 2015 News Frosty ... Alice Springs can prepare themselves for their coldest four-day spell in three years with an average of only eight degrees, combining night-time and daytime temperatures. Source: Supplied
Originally published as Coldest snap in five years to hit
